result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel G Feldman

records.addlTxt:
COURT REMOVES SCRAM MONITORING CONDITION. 
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.    Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.   Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

11:09 AM Defendant Daniel G Feldman in court.  Attorney Morgan Risseeuw in court for Daniel G Feldman. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 
Case called for bail/bond hearing.
Defense requests removal of SCRAM monitoring advising the court that the defendant has had no violations in 180 days.
Defendant has entered AODA treatment. 
State objects to the removal of the SCRAM. 
Court grants removal of SCRAM. 
Defendant to sign modified bond.
Bail/bond hearing on August 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Motion to Modify Bail filed by Atty. Risseeuw.

**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 08/09/22--Set for a bail/bond hearing within a week.**
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

09:18 AM Defendant Daniel G Feldman in court with attorney Morgan Risseeuw.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Julian Marrufo, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is in treatment.
Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing on August 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:04 AM Defendant Daniel G Feldman in court with attorney Morgan Risseeuw.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense has discovery and is waiting on an offer and requests another status date.  Court sets another status in 45 days.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on June 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.

08:16 AM Defendant Daniel G Feldman in court with attorney Morgan Risseeuw.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary hearing on June 1, 2022 at 08:15 am.

10:20 AM Defendant Daniel G Feldman in court with attorney Glenn Gaskill for attorney Morgan Risseeuw.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt: Notice of Retainer filed by Atty Morgan Risseeuw

Adjustment Number: 22A 016954,
Payable Number: 463716,
Receipt Number: 22R 018185,
Amount: $20.00
Hearing on April 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.    Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.   Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS. CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM. The Defendant to report to WCS within 1 business day of being released.

01:59 PM Defendant Daniel G Feldman in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Attorney appears as friend of the court. Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
The Court puts the Defendant on notice that any WCS non compliance letter is filed, the Court will revoke bail and issue a warrant.  Hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
